info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:27AM EST until December 18 at 7:07PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Perkiomen Creek At Graterford affecting Montgomery County. For the Perkiomen Creek...including Graterford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Perkiomen Creek at Graterford. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Park Avenue in Schwenksville is flooded. The Perkiomen Trail is flooded in Perkiomen Township at Plank Road and Route 113. At 11.0 feet, Graterford Road and Penitentiary Bridge are closed due to flooding. At 12.0 feet, Portions of Central Perkiomen Park in Collegeville are flooded. Flood waters expand onto and to the west of First Avenue in Collegeville. At 13.0 feet, First Avenue in Collegeville becomes impassable. At 14.0 feet, Storm sewers back up in Collegeville and flood Route 29. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:01 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 06/28/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Perkiomen Creek Graterford 11.0 10.9 Mon 4 am 3.9 3.6 13.7 7am 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
